IYieldManager","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"{LongShort} contract, including:  - Ability for users to create synthetic long and short positions on value movements  - Value movements could be derived from tradional or alternative asset classes, derivates, binary outcomes, etc...  - Incentive mechansim providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book) ******* SYSTEM FUNCTIONING V0.0 *********** System accepts stable coin (DAI) and has a total locked value = short position value + long position value If percentage movement as calculated from oracle is +10%, and short position value == long position value, Then value change = long position value * 10% long position value = long position value + value change short position value = short position value - value change Total contract value remains unchanged. long value has increased and each longtoken is now worth more as underlying pool value has increased. Tokens representing a shares in the short or long token pool can be minted at price (short position value) / (total short token value) or conversely burned to redeem the underlying share of the pool calculated as (short position value) / (total short token value) per token Depending on demand of minting and burning for underlying on both sides (long/short of contract), most often short position value != long position value (there will be an imbalance) Imbalances also naturally occur as the contract adjusts these values after observing oracle value changes Incentives exist to best incentivize contract balance. Mechanism 1 - interest accural imbalance. The entire total locked value accrues interest and distributes it 50/50 even if imbalance exists. I.e. Short side supplys $50 capital. Long side supply $150. Short side effectively earns interest on $100. Enhanced yield exists for sides taking on the position with less demand. Mechanism 2 - liquidity fees earned. The side which is shorter on liquidity will receive fees strengthening their value Whenever liquidity is added to the opposing side or withdrawn from their side (i.e. when the imbalance increases) ******* KNOWN ATTACK VECTORS *********** (1) Feeless withdrawl: [FIXED] Long position $150, Short position $100. User should pay fee to remove short liquidity. Step1: User mints $51 of short position (No fee to add liquidity). Step2: User redeems $100 of short position (no fee as currently removing liquidity from bigger side) Possible solution, check after deposit/withdrawl if order book has flipped, then apply fees. (2) FlashLoan mint: [ONGOING] Consider rapid large entries and exit of the system. (3) Oracle manipulation: [ONGOING] If the oracle determining price change can be easy manipulated (and by a decent magnitude), Funds could be at risk. See: https://blog.trailofbits.com/2020/08/05/accidentally-stepping-on-a-defi-lego/ ******* Work on gas effciencies *********** Layer 2 solutions Remove safe Math library","kind":"dev","methods":{},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"_updateSystemState(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates the value of the long and short sides within the system Note this is public. Anyone can call this function."},"getLatestPrice(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the latest price"},"getLiquidFunds(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the amount of funds that LongShort can directly transfer. Funds locked in the yield managers have to be withdrawn first."},"getLongBeta(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns % of long position that is filled"},"getShortBeta(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns % of short position that is filled zero div error if both are zero"},"getYieldSplit(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the amount of accrued interest that should go to the market, and the amount that should be locked into dao funds. To incentivise market balance, more interest goes to the market in proportion to how imbalanced it is. TODO: use this for the fee mechanism as well?"},"mintLong(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Create a long position"},"mintLongAndStake(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Creates a long position and stakes it"},"mintShort(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Creates a short position"},"mintShortAndStake(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Creates a short position and stakes it"},"newSyntheticMarket(string,string,address,address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"MULTISIG ADMIN CREATE MARKETS documentation.text:
@dev {LongShort} contract, including:
  - Ability for users to create synthetic long and short positions on value movements
  - Value movements could be derived from tradional or alternative asset classes, derivates, binary outcomes, etc...
  - Incentive mechansim providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book)
 ******* SYSTEM FUNCTIONING V0.0 ***********
 System accepts stable coin (DAI) and has a total locked value = short position value + long position value
 If percentage movement as calculated from oracle is +10%, and short position value == long position value,
 Then value change = long position value * 10%
 long position value = long position value + value change
 short position value = short position value - value change
 Total contract value remains unchanged.
 long value has increased and each longtoken is now worth more as underlying pool value has increased.
 Tokens representing a shares in the short or long token pool can be minted
 at price (short position value) / (total short token value)
 or conversely burned to redeem the underlying share of the pool calculated
 as (short position value) / (total short token value) per token
 Depending on demand of minting and burning for underlying on both sides (long/short of contract),
 most often short position value != long position value (there will be an imbalance)
 Imbalances also naturally occur as the contract adjusts these values after observing oracle value changes
 Incentives exist to best incentivize contract balance.
 Mechanism 1 - interest accural imbalance.
 The entire total locked value accrues interest and distributes it 50/50 even if imbalance exists.
 I.e. Short side supplys $50 capital. Long side supply $150. Short side effectively earns interest on $100.
 Enhanced yield exists for sides taking on the position with less demand.
 Mechanism 2 - liquidity fees earned.
 The side which is shorter on liquidity will receive fees strengthening their value
 Whenever liquidity is added to the opposing side or withdrawn from their side (i.e. when the imbalance increases)
 ******* KNOWN ATTACK VECTORS ***********
 (1) Feeless withdrawl:
 [FIXED]
 Long position $150, Short position $100. User should pay fee to remove short liquidity.
 Step1: User mints $51 of short position (No fee to add liquidity).
 Step2: User redeems $100 of short position (no fee as currently removing liquidity from bigger side)
 Possible solution, check after deposit/withdrawl if order book has flipped, then apply fees.
 (2) FlashLoan mint:
 [ONGOING]
 Consider rapid large entries and exit of the system.
 (3) Oracle manipulation:
 [ONGOING]
 If the oracle determining price change can be easy manipulated (and by a decent magnitude),
 Funds could be at risk. See: https://blog.trailofbits.com/2020/08/05/accidentally-stepping-on-a-defi-lego/
 ******* Work on gas effciencies ***********
 Layer 2 solutions
 Remove safe Math library
Necessary to update system state before any contract actions (deposits / withdraws)

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory,string memory,uint256) external returns (contract SyntheticToken)
function (string memory,string memory,uint256) external returns (contract SyntheticToken)

documentation.text:
Returns the amount of funds that LongShort can directly transfer.
 Funds locked in the yield managers have to be withdrawn first.
Returns % of long position that is filled

Returns % of short position that is filled
 zero div error if both are zero

Returns the amount of accrued interest that should go to the market,
 and the amount that should be locked into dao funds. To incentivise
 market balance, more interest goes to the market in proportion to how
 imbalanced it is.
 TODO: use this for the fee mechanism as well?
Adjusts the long/short token prices according to supply and value.
Controls what happens with mint/redeem fees.
Controls what happens with accrued yield manager interest.

Updates the value of the long and short sides within the system
 Note this is public. Anyone can call this function.

Calculates fees for the given mint/redeem amount. Users are penalised
 with higher fees for imbalancing the market.
Creates a long position and stakes it
Creates a short position and stakes it

attributes.text:
@dev {LongShort} contract, including:
  - Ability for users to create synthetic long and short positions on value movements
  - Value movements could be derived from tradional or alternative asset classes, derivates, binary outcomes, etc...
  - Incentive mechansim providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book)
 ******* SYSTEM FUNCTIONING V0.0 ***********
 System accepts stable coin (DAI) and has a total locked value = short position value + long position value
 If percentage movement as calculated from oracle is +10%, and short position value == long position value,
 Then value change = long position value * 10%
 long position value = long position value + value change
 short position value = short position value - value change
 Total contract value remains unchanged.
 long value has increased and each longtoken is now worth more as underlying pool value has increased.
 Tokens representing a shares in the short or long token pool can be minted
 at price (short position value) / (total short token value)
 or conversely burned to redeem the underlying share of the pool calculated
 as (short position value) / (total short token value) per token
 Depending on demand of minting and burning for underlying on both sides (long/short of contract),
 most often short position value != long position value (there will be an imbalance)
 Imbalances also naturally occur as the contract adjusts these values after observing oracle value changes
 Incentives exist to best incentivize contract balance.
 Mechanism 1 - interest accural imbalance.
 The entire total locked value accrues interest and distributes it 50/50 even if imbalance exists.
 I.e. Short side supplys $50 capital. Long side supply $150. Short side effectively earns interest on $100.
 Enhanced yield exists for sides taking on the position with less demand.
 Mechanism 2 - liquidity fees earned.
 The side which is shorter on liquidity will receive fees strengthening their value
 Whenever liquidity is added to the opposing side or withdrawn from their side (i.e. when the imbalance increases)
 ******* KNOWN ATTACK VECTORS ***********
 (1) Feeless withdrawl:
 [FIXED]
 Long position $150, Short position $100. User should pay fee to remove short liquidity.
 Step1: User mints $51 of short position (No fee to add liquidity).
 Step2: User redeems $100 of short position (no fee as currently removing liquidity from bigger side)
 Possible solution, check after deposit/withdrawl if order book has flipped, then apply fees.
 (2) FlashLoan mint:
 [ONGOING]
 Consider rapid large entries and exit of the system.
 (3) Oracle manipulation:
 [ONGOING]
 If the oracle determining price change can be easy manipulated (and by a decent magnitude),
 Funds could be at risk. See: https://blog.trailofbits.com/2020/08/05/accidentally-stepping-on-a-defi-lego/
 ******* Work on gas effciencies ***********
 Layer 2 solutions
 Remove safe Math library
Necessary to update system state before any contract actions (deposits / withdraws)

Tokens representing a shares in the short or long token pool can be minted at price (short position value) / (total short token value) or conversely burned to redeem the underlying share of the pool calculated as (short position value) / (total short token value) per token Depending on demand of minting and burning for underlying on both sides (long/short of contract), most often short position value != long position value (there will be an imbalance) Imbalances also naturally occur as the contract adjusts these values after observing oracle value changes Incentives exist to best incentivize contract balance. Short side effectively earns interest on $100. Enhanced yield exists for sides taking on the position with less demand. Mechanism 2 - liquidity fees earned. Step2: User redeems $100 of short position (no fee as currently removing liquidity from bigger side) Possible solution, check after deposit/withdrawl if order book has flipped, then apply fees. _updateSystemState(uint256).notice: Updates the value of the long and short sides within the system Note this is public. Anyone can call this function.

getLiquidFunds(uint256).notice: Returns the amount of funds that LongShort can directly transfer. Funds locked in the yield managers have to be withdrawn first.

getLongBeta(uint256).notice: Returns % of long position that is filled

getShortBeta(uint256).notice: Returns % of short position that is filled zero div error if both are zero

getYieldSplit(uint256,uint256).notice: Returns the amount of accrued interest that should go to the market, and the amount that should be locked into dao funds. To incentivise market balance, more interest goes to the market in proportion to how imbalanced it is. TODO: use this for the fee mechanism as well?

mintLongAndStake(uint256,uint256).notice: Creates a long position and stakes it

mintShortAndStake(uint256,uint256).notice: Creates a short position and stakes it
